== git symbolic-ref ==

{{{
    git symbolic-ref [-q] [--short] <name>
    git symbolic-ref [-m <reason>] <name> <ref>
    git symbolic-ref --delete [-q] <name>
}}}

-   When given on argument, reads which branch head the given symbolic refers
    to and outputs its path, relative to the `.git` directory.
    {{{
        git symbolic-ref HEAD
    }}}

    This will output the path refered by the symbolic ref `HEAD`.

-   When given two arguments, creates or updates a symbolic ref `name` to point
    at the given branch `ref`
    {{{
        git symbolic-ref DEV refs/heads/dev
    }}}

    In this command, if the symbolic ref `DEV` doesn't exist, it will create a
    symbolic ref named with `DEV`, then refers it to `refs/heads/dev`.
    Otherwise it will just update the content of symbolic ref `DEV` to
    `refs/heads/dev`.

-   When given `--delete` and an additional argument, deletes the given
    symbolic ref.
    {{{
        git symbolic-ref --delete DEV
    }}}

    This command will delete symbolic ref `DEV` created before.
